title: E field - two spheres on 3m x 4m rectangle corners

content.question: Two small, positively charged spheres are located at the top corners of a rectangle, as shown in the figure. The sphere at the top-left corner has a charge of <math alttext="3.0 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>μC</mi></math>, and the sphere at the top-right corner has a charge of <math alttext="10.0 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μC</mtext></math>. The length and width of the rectangle are as indicated. What is the magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> of the electric field at the lower-left corner of the rectangle?

choices.label: <math alttext="4700 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4700</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5900 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>5900</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="6600 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>6600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="8000 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>8000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5900 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>5900</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
